title: How seriously does Riot take ingame sexual harassment?
body:
Odd topic for a video game, I know. I have played since preseason one and for the first time a player actually made me feel uncomfortable in match. I have had every kind of internet insult thrown my way over the years but this one player is the first to really bother me. 

He spent all game pestering me asking how old I was, if I was a guy or girl and saying we should date. I simply refused to answer his questions and when he asked if we could date I said no. He just kept fucking asking. "We should date" "wanna facetime?" "heres my discord lets facetime" "saddle up" "I bet you are sexy" "I just wanna date you". I get that it was probably some dumbass just trying to be funny or something but I have never encountered this before. How seriously does Riot take reports on stuff like this? 

I didn't really care until I said no and he kept pestering. All fucking match. Another player commented on how the team should report him for harassment and he just said 'lul' and kept going.

Glad you guys take this issue seriously.  A vastly smaller version of this happened to me, long ago, when I was playing Ashe with a Tryndamere on my team.  I thought he just wanted the lore-teamup, but the player suddenly got creepy!  Wish I had known you guys answered posts like this.

The first thing to point out is that you don't have to put up with this guy. Just mute him as soon as he looks like he's going to be a problem. It's not like he's suddenly going to start using the chat productively...

        I don't know that there's a specific policy on sexual harassment, except insofar as it is a form of harassment. Harassment in any form is absolutely unacceptable and will be punished accordingly, provided that the person gets reported. 

      Sorry you had to put up with this.

That would have been the right thing to do but I had just made that account the day this happened and I never thought to switch over on the boards.

Same thing just happened to me and I looked it up to get the same question answered.

 I just came from a game that I was playing with my girlfriend. She's fairly new and still learning the game, but she didn't mind playing against higher levels if I could play with her and teach her either way. In a game I just played, she was doing poorly. A Twisted Fate and a Braum on our team were being toxic, so I mentioned that she was my girlfriend and that I was teaching her. (Yes, I know that in itself was a mistake, but they were starting to get offensive rather than toxic and I felt like I had to explain.) The rest of the game, however, they started making serious jokes about sexual harassment. "btw teemo I'm gonna rape your girl after this" "she's a whore" I told them from what I know, that level of sexual harassment could possibly be a perma ban, and the Braum responded "doesn't matter if I get some tight virgin p*ssy" It was bad enough that she was actually scared and stopped playing. I don't know what the level of punishment can go, but I was personally really offended and just curious. Thanks.

I'm curious, and I hope I convey no offense by asking this:

If you refused to answer, did he continue to sexually harass you without any confirmation of your sex? That seems super odd to me. Then again, I don't exactly know how the mind of somebody like that would work.

In my experience, if someone doesn't answer about their age, younger guys can assume that it's a teenage girl who is shy about admitting she's a girl.  Which would fit with why he kept going, and then made even more pointed comments over time.
